Title: (Junior) Product Manager (w/m/d)
Description:

Du entwickelst kreative Produktkonzepte und setzt diese von der Idee bis zur Markteinf√ºhrung erfolgreich um

Du verbindest kreatives Denken mit ausgepr√§gten analytischen F√§higkeiten

Du √ºberzeugst durch exzellente Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten und sicheres Auftreten

Du beherrscht die deutsche Sprache auf muttersprachlichem Niveau (mindestens C1) und die englische Sprache absolut sicher in Wort und Schrift (mindestens B2)


Deine Benefits


Wachse √ºber dich hinaus - bei uns erwarten dich abwechslungsreiche T√§tigkeiten mit viel Verantwortung und der M√∂glichkeit, dich mit uns gemeinsam weiter zu entwickeln
Wir bieten dir eine bessere Work-Life-Balance, durch flexible Arbeitszeiten, die Option 2 Tage aus dem Home-Office zu arbeiten und 28 Urlaubstagen im Jahr
On top hast du die M√∂glichkeit auf 10 Tage Workation im Jahr
Selbstverst√§ndlich bekommst du von uns die Hardware gestellt, die du f√ºr deinen Job bei uns ben√∂tigst
Lust auf Lik√∂r? Bei uns erh√§ltst du Mitarbeiterrabatt auf unsere Produkte sowohl als einen freien 700ml Lik√∂r beim Launch von jeder neuen Sorte
Sei Teil eines famili√§ren und dynamischen Unternehmens - wir legen viel Wert auf eine Kommunikation auf Augenh√∂he und feiern gerne zusammen unsere Erfolge zweimal im Jahr bei unserer Winter- und Sommerparty. Dar√ºber hinaus f√∂rdern wir regelm√§√üige Teamevents
Du bekommst Zugriff auf unsere Corporate Benefits und deine bAV bezuschussen wir mit 25%
Du kannst dich zwischen einem Zuschuss f√ºr den √ñPNV, Urban Sports Club oder JobRad entscheiden


Du m√∂chtest Teil unseres Moonshine-Teams werden? Super, wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

√úber uns

Seit 2014 l√§sst O'Donnell Moonshine die Tradition des Moonshine wieder auferstehen ‚Äì in amerikanische Einmachgl√§ser abgef√ºllt, vertreiben wir unsere Lik√∂re als mittlerweile gr√∂√üter Moonshine-Produzent Europas von Berlin aus in die ganze Welt.

Dabei arbeiten wir ganz nach dem Motto: Am besten wird es, wenn man es selbst macht. Wir verzichten im Grunde vollst√§ndig auf externe Auslagerungen und organisieren stattdessen alle relevanten Aufgaben selbst aus unserem Headquarter in Berlin. Ein ‚ÄúDas haben wir noch nie gemacht!‚Äù h√§lt uns nicht auf, denn einmal ist schlie√ülich immer das erste mal. Deshalb besteht unser Team mittlerweile aus √ºber 120 motivierten und kreativen Leuten von √ºber 16 Nationalit√§ten, die gern mal neue Wege gehen. Und daf√ºr suchen wir genau dich!

Title: Product Manager - We-Vibe
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 900 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a Product Manager for our premium brand We-Vibe to join our team in Berlin. This role is integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with teams in Engineering, Product Design, Manufacturing, and Marketing, your focus will be on managing product development and lifecycle while ensuring market success.

What You Will Do


Lead product development and market introduction for the We-Vibe brand within a cross-functional, international team.
Coordinate cross-departmental teams, managing the product life cycle, and ensuring alignment with the overall product strategy for optimal market positioning.
Develop and implement detailed project plans, including reporting on key milestones and KPIs to the management decision board.
Conduct comprehensive product and market research to understand market trends, the competitive landscape, and customer feedback, contributing to strategic decision-making.
Oversee all aspects of product or feature introduction, ensuring customer-oriented design and execution.



What You Should Bring


A driven professional with a strong passion for developing physical products and a deep understanding of the product life cycle's complexities.
A degree in economics, business administration, marketing, engineering, or a related field.
Extensive experience in product management, and coordinating international, interdisciplinary teams.
Exceptional attention to detail, time management, and prioritisation capabilities.
Outstanding communication skills, both in writing and speaking, coupled with social, professional, and entrepreneurial competencies.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, fostering a sense of community.
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days‚Äô holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration.
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
Customized training opportunities to support your learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles for valuable insights and growth.
Gym benefits and a mental wellbeing platform to ensure you thrive both professionally and personall



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Senior Product Manager
Product Manager (m/w/d)
Description:
Berlin, DE

Octopus Energy Germany üá©üá™ ‚Äì Product Management /

Full-time /

Hybrid



At Octopus Energy, we‚Äôre transforming the energy industry by making it greener, fairer, and better for people and the planet. Powered by our cutting-edge Kraken technology, we‚Äôre delivering transparency, simplicity, and innovation to millions of customers globally. Our mission is backed by Generation Investment Management, co-chaired by Al Gore, and we're proud to be Europe's best-funded green tech start-up, continuously recognized as a great place to work.

As we continue our expansion across Europe, we're looking for a talented and driven Product Manager to join our EU OE Engineering team, focusing on supporting the growth of Octopus Energy Germany. If you‚Äôre excited about building world-class products that contribute to a low-carbon future, this is the role for you.

What You'll Do:


Collaborate with cross-functional teams: You‚Äôll gather requirements and translate them into tasks for developers, ensuring smooth collaboration with designers, developers, and stakeholding teams within OE Germany.
Manage and prioritise needs: Work closely with our Germany focused team and EU Engineering to align local requirements with broader regional strategies. You‚Äôll help scope out new features, plan iterations and drive product development that maximises customer value.
Drive innovation: Think strategically about client-facing tools, helping empower users through self-service features and continuously improving their experience.
Own the process: From gathering feedback to reporting on project progress, you‚Äôll be responsible for the full product lifecycle, driving high-impact initiatives that support our mission.
Adapt and solve problems: In a fast-paced environment, you‚Äôll be expected to make quick decisions, recognizing what needs attention now and what can wait, while ensuring long-term success.



What You'll Bring:

Strategic and hands-on thinking: Whether it's working on a high-level product strategy or rolling up your sleeves to execute a feature, you‚Äôre adaptable and thrive in a dynamic environment.
Technological curiosity: While deep technical knowledge isn‚Äôt essential, familiarity with development processes and tools like Asana, Notion, Miro, and Figma will help you to hit the ground running.
Multi-tasking master: You can juggle multiple priorities, switch contexts quickly, and make decisions efficiently while keeping an empathetic, team-focused approach.
Energy sector insight: While not mandatory, prior experience in the german energy industry would be a great advantage.



Why Join Us:


Purpose-driven mission: Be a key player in the global energy transition and contribute to the decarbonization of one of the most essential industries.
Innovative environment: Work at the cutting edge of technology with one of the fastest-growing energy tech companies in the world.
Autonomy and trust: We empower our teams with the freedom and responsibility to make impactful decisions.
Collaborative culture: You‚Äôll be part of a passionate, diverse, and globally-minded product and tech team, united by a shared mission to revolutionise energy.
Flexible work environment: This hybrid role allows you to split your time between our offices in Germany and remote work, with opportunities to travel to other European offices.



Join us at Octopus Energy Engineering and play a central role in driving forward the energy revolution in Germany and across Europe!

Title: (Junior) Product Growth Manager (all genders)
Description:
As Europe's fastest-growing unicorn, we revolutionize eCommerce globally. Through strategic acquisitions, scaling initiatives, and cutting-edge technology, we're the top player in the industry. Following our recent acquisition of Perch - the leading US aggregator - and a successful Series D funding round led by Presight Captial, we're aimed toward a $1 billion top-line business!

Your Role

As a (Junior) Product Growth Manager at Razor Group, your primary focus will be on identifying and executing new product launch opportunities across the brand portfolio. You will play a crucial role in accelerating sales growth through the introduction of new products in various categories, such as home interior goods, toys, pets, outdoor equipment, sports gear, and more. Overall, your role as a Junior Product Growth Manager at Razor Group will be dynamic and critical to the company's success in driving sales growth through new product innovation!

Your responsibilities will include:


conducting market research to assess the demand, competition, and profitability of potential new products
developing strategies for product differentiation and pricing that will give the new products a competitive advantage in the market; involves conducting competitor analysis and identifying unique selling points for the products
collaborating with vendors to negotiate favorable terms on pricing, product features, and minimum order quantities; building strong relationships with vendors will be crucial to ensuring the successful launch of new products
continuously challenging and improving existing processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness
identifying areas that can be automated to streamline operations and enable faster decision-making
working closely with brand managers to brainstorm and develop new product ideas
collaborating and communicating effectively with cross-functional teams as it will be essential in bringing new products to market


Your Profile

To succeed in this role you:


have at least 1 year of relevant experience in a fast-paced startup, a consulting firm, or a marketing/product role at an e-commerce/FMCG company
completed a bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field
thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and being proactive with a hands-on approach
hold strong project management skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
have an eye for detail to help you in analyzing data and spotting opportunities
possess proficient Excel skills for effective communication and data analysis
have experience with e-commerce and/or Amazon FBA businesses is a plus, it is not a mandatory requirement!
are business fluent in English; other languages are a plus!


About Razor Group

We are revolutionizing the e-commerce world, reaching over $1 billion in value and over $700 million in revenue, with the backing of top investors like Black Rock, VPC, and Fortress, Apollo, 468 Capital, Rocket Internet. Along with Perch and our previous acquisitions of Factory14 in Spain, Valoreo in Latin America, and our German competitor Stryze, we now operate a catalogue of over 40,000 products across 3 continents and 10+ countries. Headquartered in Berlin, we are also present in Austin, Boston, Delhi NCR, Hangzhou, and Mexico City!

Title: Product Manager (m/d/f)
Description:
About Us

METYCLE - where innovation meets sustainability

We are building the B2B online platform to accelerate the global circular flow of secondary metals. By connecting buyers and sellers of scrap metal globally, we are enabling efficient trade of secondary metals and are driving the seamless flow of recycling material, essential for reducing CO2 emissions by up to 95% compared to primary metal production.

Join us at the early stage in bringing the $610 billion scrap metal trading industry into the 21st century and in shaping the future of metal recycling and green energy solutions.

READY TO MAKE AN IMPACT?

If you‚Äôre passionate about driving innovation in a fast-paced environment and excel at the intersection of technology, strategy, and collaboration, join us as a Product Manager. Take the lead in shaping a company at the forefront of optimizing operations and achieving scalability through data-driven decision-making.

Be part of our international team and take ownership of shaping METYCLE‚Äôs efforts to revolutionize the scrap metal trading industry and build a greener future.

Your mission


Collaborate with product leadership to define and drive the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for data and operations tools and processes, ensuring alignment with the overarching company vision
Identify opportunities to leverage data for process optimization, improved decision-making, and business impact
Collaborate with data teams to define and monitor key performance metrics (KPIs)
Design and implement systems to optimize workflows and improve operational efficiency across teams
Lead change management efforts to ensure smooth adoption of new tools and processes by the operations teams
Develop training materials, conduct onboarding and support sessions to empower operations teams with product knowledge
Identify and mitigate bottlenecks in existing processes through innovative solutions
Understand and communicate technical requirements, dependencies, and limitations to non-technical stakeholders
Manage cross-functional projects, ensuring timely delivery of product features and operational improvements


Your profile


Solid experience as a Product Manager, ideally on technical or data-related products
Familiarity with data engineering and data science workflows, as well as downstream integration
Proven ability to deliver results iteratively, aligning product features with stakeholder requirements
An outcome-oriented mindset, ensuring every iteration contributes to the overall vision
Experience working with diverse stakeholder groups, such as software developers, engineers, managers, and marketing professionals
Strong decision-making skills and the ability to prioritize effectively in a complex environment
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating technical concepts for diverse stakeholders
Valid for work permit for Germany


Why join us?


You will have the opportunity to challenge the status quo and work on an innovative venture with a significant impact
You will be able to take ownership and shape the future of metal recycling and green energy solutions at an early stage
We offer a competitive salary including virtual company shares
We offer an environment with flat hierarchies and a steep learning curve with exciting growth opportunities
You will benefit from flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely or from a shared office location
We promote an inclusive, diverse and supportive work environment


Contact

Discover More About METYCLE

About us | LinkedIn

We look forward to receiving your application. Irene Prinz is happy to answer any questions you may have: +49 152 34 62 72 85.

Title: Product Manager (f/m/x)
Description:
We are looking for an exceptional Product Manager (f/m/x) to join our ambitious team. In this role you will play a central role in shaping our product by translating customer needs, market trends and company goals into a unified language. You will work closely with different teams, e.g. Development and Sales, to drive the development of an innovative training platform that exceeds our customers' expectations. We offer you a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of shaping the future of frontline worker training.

Your Tasks


Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify customer needs and market trends to ensure doinstruct remains at the forefront of innovation
Collaborate with internal stakeholders including Development and Sales to define product requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria
Prioritizing and managing the product backlog based on customer value and our goals
Introduce and monitor key product metrics, perform data analysis and use customer feedback to identify opportunities for optimization and growth
Work closely with the development team and provide support throughout the product lifecycle


What we offer:


Be a Catalyst for Change: Join us in revolutionizing Learning & Development for frontline workers, making a tangible impact on their lives and career growth. Be part of a company that‚Äôs not just about business but also about doing good, by making education and training accessible to Frontline Workers.
Ownership from Day One: Step into a role where your ideas matter, and you have the autonomy to shape projects and drive them to success. We are a small but growing team which means experiencing the thrill of working in a startup environment with flat hierarchies, where creativity and innovation are encouraged and celebrated.
Grow with Us: Embrace the opportunity to learn from a passionate and highly motivated team, where knowledge sharing and mutual growth are core values. Thrive in a culture that fosters teamwork, open communication, and collective problem-solving.
Make Your Mark: Every contribution you make helps us move closer to our vision, giving you a sense of purpose and accomplishment.
Flexibility and Balance: Enjoy a work environment that understands the importance of flexibility and work-life balance, allowing you to excel both professionally and personally. Be part of our Co-Working Space in Berlin or our office in Osnabr√ºck with very flexible Remote-days.
Recent Investment Round: doinstruct secured $7M funding in a Seed Round led by European early-stage investor Creandum, an early backer of Spotify, Klarna and iZettle. This means that we not only benefit from a stable financial situation, but also from strong networks, experienced investors and committed mentors who support us along the way.


What we expect:


You have experience in SaaS product management in a successful startup/scaleup
You have high expectations of yourself and the product
You prefer open communication, continuous feedback and short decision paths
You enjoy working closely with Development and Sales to bring new features to life
You are able to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and can communicate ideas clearly
Excellent communication skills in written and spoken English


____

At doinstruct, you can make full use of your skills and play an active role in the further development of our start-up. And yes, we attach great importance to a positive working atmosphere, maximum transparency, communication at eye level, and support every step of your personal and professional development.

Even if you don't tick all of the boxes, but you are motivated and want to work with us, you are very welcome to apply.

We embrace diversity and hire people based on their ability to perform a job. People of any race, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, political opinion, or marital status are welcome at doinstruct.

_

For questions or remarks please reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager, Leonard, at leonard.mielke@doinstruct.com.

Title: Product Manager (f/m/d)
Description:
DEINE AUFGABEN

Als Product Manager in einem unserer Mission Teams spielst du eine zentrale Rolle beim Aufbau und Wachstum des Produktbereichs und der Ergebnisse, indem du das Team von der Discovery bis zur Implementierung und dar√ºber hinaus f√ºhrst.

DAS MACHT ARBEITEN BEI LOFINO SO EINZIGARTIG

√úber uns

LOFINO ist ein junges und nachhaltiges HR-Tech Startup, das mittlerweile √ºber 50 Mitarbeiter:innen umfasst. Wir arbeiten gerne remote und sch√§tzen den pers√∂nlichen Austausch an unseren Hauptniederlassungen in Berlin und M√ºnchen gleicherma√üen.
